summary: Diff implements dark mode via next-themes with a Light/Dark/System toggle in the authenticated user menu, updates global CSS theme tokens for a bold high-contrast palette (light + dark), and adds global heading typography defaults. However, the diff also includes several functional/behavioral changes unrelated to theming (routing/query logic changes, onboarding flow changes, client profile behavior changes), which appear out of scope per the non-goals.

hallucinated_features.description: React Query/data-fetching behavior changes (gating on backend readiness, timing instrumentation, enabled queries vs refetching) that go beyond theming/styling.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest is strictly about theming (dark mode, palette, typography/layout) and explicitly lists non-goals including not reworking backend connection logic; these changes alter app data-fetch behavior.

hallucinated_features.description: Routing hook change to return bigint | null for client codes (type/behavioral change).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by theming requirements and constitutes application logic/type-safety adjustments outside UI theme scope.

hallucinated_features.description: Client onboarding flow changed to a wizard-style multi-step flow.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest non-goals explicitly disallow adding/reworking application features; a wizard flow is a functional UX change beyond styling.

hallucinated_features.description: Client profile page behavior changes (wiring FollowUpSection with onMarkDone handler, FollowUpPromptDialog manual mode, passing client array to ExportClientsExcelDialog).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested for theming and appears to modify client follow-up/export behavior, which is application functionality outside the specified theme work.
